item.title: Runescape Cache System
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:14, topic:403378”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=500438.msg3660125#msg3660125 date=1310317992]
Just fixed a major bug with the cache archive class and hit a bit of understanding, cache index 1 - 4 are GZIPed without an archive format.

int i = 0;
            synchronized(gzip_buffer) {              
                try
                {
                    GZIPInputStream gzipinputstream = new GZIPInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(bytes));
                    do
                    {
                        if(i == gzip_buffer.length)
                            throw new RuntimeException("buffer overflow!");
                        int k = gzipinputstream.read(gzip_buffer, i, gzip_buffer.length - i);
                        if(k == -1)
                            break;
                        i += k;
                    } while(true);
                }
                catch(IOException _ex)
                {
                    throw new RuntimeException("error unzipping");
                }
            }
            bytes = new byte[i];
            System.arraycopy(gzip_buffer, 0, bytes, 0, i);

[/quote]
They’re bzip2’d and headerless if i recall?[/quote]

The formatted ones are, well depends on if the entries are compressed or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Cache System
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:7, topic:403378”]Just fixed a major bug with the cache archive class and hit a bit of understanding, cache index 1 - 4 are GZIPed without an archive format.

int i = 0; synchronized(gzip_buffer) { try { GZIPInputStream gzipinputstream = new GZIPInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(bytes)); do { if(i == gzip_buffer.length) throw new RuntimeException("buffer overflow!"); int k = gzipinputstream.read(gzip_buffer, i, gzip_buffer.length - i); if(k == -1) break; i += k; } while(true); } catch(IOException _ex) { throw new RuntimeException("error unzipping"); } } bytes = new byte[i]; System.arraycopy(gzip_buffer, 0, bytes, 0, i); [/quote]
They’re bzip2’d and headerless if i recall?

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Cache System
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Just fixed a major bug with the cache archive class and hit a bit of understanding, cache index 1 - 4 are GZIPed without an archive format.

int i = 0;
            synchronized(gzip_buffer) {              
                try
                {
                    GZIPInputStream gzipinputstream = new GZIPInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(bytes));
                    do
                    {
                        if(i == gzip_buffer.length)
                            throw new RuntimeException("buffer overflow!");
                        int k = gzipinputstream.read(gzip_buffer, i, gzip_buffer.length - i);
                        if(k == -1)
                            break;
                        i += k;
                    } while(true);
                }
                catch(IOException _ex)
                {
                    throw new RuntimeException("error unzipping");
                }
            }
            bytes = new byte[i];
            System.arraycopy(gzip_buffer, 0, bytes, 0, i);
